Yunbin Bae does UX Research & Design to Humanize Technology and build Community Engagement by finding problems rooted in harmful designs.

I like to exist in between.

M.S in Innovation (HCI) @ Yonsei Uni (incoming March)

Researcher & Product Management at Relief's Map (Feb, 2022~)

based in Seoul, South Korea



Spy Camera Detector

A UX Case Study on how the spy camera detector application, Relief's Map, offers vague means to understand women's safety from spy cameras in Korea, and even has the potential to abuse womenâ€™s fear and learned helplessness on spy cameras. To design for empowering marginalized people, I urge the importance of acknowledging the complexity of oppressed group's social psychology that centers around fear, learned helplessness, and indignation. Used Ethnographic Research methodology, processed prototyping and user testing, and met the corporation for detailed information and insights.

Since Oct 2021 & from Research to Prototyping and a Corporate Meeting
